meanings.definition: Had good or bad fortune by chance.
meanings.sent1: She lucked into finding a four-leaf clover.
meanings.sent2: He lucked out and won the raffle.
meanings.sent3: The cat lucked into catching the mouse.
meanings.sent4: The detective lucked onto a crucial clue.
meanings.sent5: The student lucked upon the correct answer.

meanings.sent1: They lucked into getting front-row seats.
meanings.sent2: I lucked out with the sunny weather for my picnic.
meanings.sent3: The team lucked into a last-minute victory.
meanings.sent4: She lucked onto a rare antique at the flea market.
meanings.sent5: He lucked upon a hidden talent for painting.

meanings.definition: To have success or failure by chance.
meanings.sent1: He lucked into a promotion at work.
meanings.sent2: She lucked out on the opportunity to travel abroad.
meanings.sent3: The gambler lucked into a winning streak at the casino.
meanings.sent4: They lucked onto a solution to the problem.
meanings.sent5: The explorer lucked upon a hidden treasure in the jungle.
